## A "normal" data set
```{r, include=FALSE, cache=FALSE}
ap = adjust_path(paste0(getwd(), "/figure"))
```

- One row per observation 
- One column per variable 

\centering
\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.1}
\begin{tabular}{c||c|cccc}
ID & $y$ & $x_1$ & $x_2$ & ... & $x_p$ \\
\hline 
1	&&&&&\\
2 &&&&&\\ 
$\vdots$ &&&&&\\ 
n &&&&&\\
\end{tabular}

## A "normal" data set (longitudinal)

- Can be displayed in wide format
- One row per observation 
- One column per variable _per timepoint_

\centering
\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.1}
\begin{tabular}{c||cccc|cccc}
ID & $y_{t=0}$ & $y_{t=1}$ & ... & $y_{t=T}$ & $x_1$ & $x_2$ & ... & $x_p$ \\
\hline 
1	&&&&&&&&\\
2 &&&&&&&&\\ 
$\vdots$ &&&&&&&&\\ 
n &&&&&&&&\\
\end{tabular}

## A "normal" data set (longitudinal)

- Can be displayed in long format
- One row per observation _per timepoint_
- One column for time plus one column per variable 

\centering
\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.1}
\begin{tabular}{c||c|c|cccc}
ID & $t$ & $y$ & $x_1$ & $x_2$ & ... & $x_p$ \\
\hline 
1	&$t_0$&&&&\\
$\vdots$ &&&&&\\ 
1 &$T$&&&&\\
$\vdots$ &&&&&\\ 
n	&$t_0$&&&&\\
$\vdots$ &&&&&\\ 
n &$T$&&&&\\
\end{tabular}

## A textual data set (examples)

- Parallel corpora for (neural) machine translation  

\centering
\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.1}
\begin{tabular}{c|c}
some language & target language \\
\hline 
$text_1$ & translation of $text_1$\\
$\vdots$ & $\vdots$ \\ 
$text_n$ & translation of $text_n$\\
\end{tabular}

- Plain, raw text (Source: _\href{https://github.com/harshilkamdar/trump-tweets}{GitHub}_)

\centering

## A textual data set (examples)

- Labeled texts (spam detection)

\centering
\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.1}
\begin{tabular}{c|c}
Spam & E-Mail content\\
\hline 
YES & $text_1$\\
NO  & $text_2$\\
YES & $text_3$\\
$\vdots$ & $\vdots$ \\ 
YES & $text_n$\\
\end{tabular}

## A textual data set (examples)

- Labeled texts (sentiment analysis)

\centering
\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.1}
\begin{tabular}{c|c}
Sentiment & Customer feedback\\
\hline 
POSITIVE & $text_1$\\
NEGATIVE & $text_2$\\
NEGATIVE & $text_3$\\
$\vdots$ & $\vdots$ \\ 
NEUTRAL &  $text_n$\\
\end{tabular}

## Difficulties with textual data

- Words, sentences & documents vary in length
- No standard $n \times p$ design matrix anymore
- What is the unit of observation?  
(Document? Paragraph? Sentence? Word? Character?)
- What (potentially high) dimension does an observation have?
